The shift in fund-sharing for VB-G RAM G could impact state government spending.

title: Trump hails ‘Board of Peace’, announces over $5 billion pledged by member states for Gaza aid
description: President Trump unveiled his "Board of Peace," a self-designed initiative for global negotiations, claiming UN Security Council endorsement for his Gaza peace vision. He announced over $5 billion pledged for Gaza's reconstruction and humanitarian aid, facilitated by the board, which he described as history's most consequential international body.  Trump will chair the board, aiming for demilitarization and world peace.

Market watchers are closely observing Federal Reserve signals for potential rate cut timelines.  Gold experienced a sharp correction in February, influenced by stronger US employment data, while silver futures saw a decline.

title: Navalny poisoned? US says won't 'dispute' report, stops short of blaming Russia
description: US secretary of state Marco Rubio stated Washington is not disputing a report by five European nations concluding Alexei Navalny was fatally poisoned. The report identified a rare toxin from a dart frog, with Russia identified as the prime suspect.  Navalny's widow declared his murder a "science-proven fact" after his death in a Russian penal colony.

description: South Korea's 'Korean Wave' has transformed from a niche phenomenon to a mainstream cultural force in India and across the globe, driven by K-pop, K-dramas, and lifestyle trends. This soft power surge, fueled by digital access and strategic state policy, offers a model for global influence, impacting consumption and aspirations across the nation.

title: India-UK trade agreement likely to come into force in April: Report
description: India and the UK's free trade agreement, signed last year, is slated for implementation by April 2026. This pact promises 99% duty-free access for Indian exports to Britain, while India will lower tariffs on cars and whisky.  Parliamentary approval is currently underway in the UK, paving the way for enhanced bilateral trade.

While Pakistan expressed openness to the gesture, India's captain remained non-committal, emphasizing a focus on cricket.

description: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju announced that the Lok Sabha will debate and vote on a no-confidence motion against the Speaker on March 9. This follows a submission by 118 Congress MPs alleging partisan conduct. Historically, such motions against Speakers are rare, with past instances including those against GV Mavalankar, Sardar Hukum Singh, and Balram Jakhar.

title: A very angry Pentagon to Anthropic: Don't lecture us, you can go and ...
description: The Pentagon is reportedly considering ending its partnership with AI firm Anthropic over restrictions on military use of its technology. Anthropic refuses to allow its AI for mass surveillance of citizens or fully autonomous weapons, frustrating defense officials. While other companies are more accommodating, Anthropic's firm stance on ethical guardrails could lead to a complete termination of their collaboration.

description: Jammu and Kashmir security agencies have frozen over 8,000 mule accounts in three years, identifying them as crucial for global scam networks and potential funding of anti-national activities. These accounts facilitate the conversion of stolen money into untraceable cryptocurrency, with authorities urging banks and law enforcement to curb their rise and identify "mulers" who manage them.

A 75-year-old man cycled 300 km with his wife: A heartwarming story that defines marriage
description: An elderly man, Babu Lohar, pedalled 300 kilometres on a modified cycle rickshaw to get his paralysed wife, Jyoti, specialised medical treatment. Their arduous nine-day journey, driven by unwavering devotion, highlighted the profound strength of their bond. Despite facing further setbacks, their story exemplifies love's quiet persistence and extraordinary action.

description: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla will represent India at the swearing-in of Bangladesh's PM-elect Tarique Rahman, following the BNP's landslide victory. Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri will accompany Birla. This event marks a significant diplomatic shift for Dhaka, especially after former PM Sheikh Hasina's ouster and subsequent exile in India. The new BNP government's stance will be closely observed.

Hafeez suggests the debate surrounding Tariq's bowling action is causing "panic" in the Indian camp, forcing them to specifically prepare for him. He urged Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha to use Tariq aggressively to maximize his game-changing potential.

Bengal man's body cut up, stuffed in bags; BLO admits murder, affair suspected
description: A primary school teacher, Rizwan Hasan Mondal, confessed to murdering Nasir Ali, a Baduria resident, after abducting him. Ali's dismembered body parts were recovered from three water bodies. Police suspect an alleged extramarital affair between Mondal and Ali's wife as the motive. Mondal's associate has also been arrested.

title: ‘Touched me repeatedly’: Bihar man held for molesting co-passenger on Hanoi flight
description: A male passenger, Abdur Rahim, was arrested at Kolkata airport after a co-passenger accused him of repeated inappropriate touching and verbal abuse during a flight from Hanoi. Airline staff intervened, moving the complainant, and handed Rahim over to authorities upon landing. He now faces molestation and verbal abuse charges.

title: Kylie Young grabs attention at WM Phoenix Open in summer frock
description: Jack Bech’s girlfriend Kylie Young used the WM Phoenix Open to quietly own the offseason, sharing sundress and golf-day looks that stood out while the Las Vegas Raiders regroup from a 3-14 year. From Phoenix to Aspen and Raiders game days, her Instagram keeps building a separate highlight reel around the rookie wide receiver.

title: Anthropic CEO again tells US govt NOT to do what Nvidia CEO has been 'begging' it for
description: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei strongly opposes selling advanced AI chips to China, viewing them as a national security risk rather than a trade commodity. He argues that such sales could lead to a dangerous AI arms race, unlike nuclear deterrence. Amodei advocates for distributing AI benefits globally while preventing authoritarian regimes from weaponizing the technology.

title: Charlie Kirk Honored by TPUSA Amid Backlash Over Bad Bunny Super Bowl Show
description: Super Bowl LX became a cultural flashpoint as Bad Bunny’s historic halftime show unfolded alongside a TPUSA alternative event honoring the late Charlie Kirk. Supporters paid tribute to Kirk with dedicated performances, while Bad Bunny delivered a cinematic, message driven production featuring over 300 dancers and a real wedding. Praise and criticism followed, including a sharp reaction from President Trump. The night highlighted a divided audience and two competing visions sharing the same stage.

title: Team Canada rules out Brad Marchand, Josh Morrissey vs Switzerland
description: Team Canada faces Switzerland at the 2026 Winter Olympics without key players Josh Morrissey and Brad Marchand. Morrissey is sidelined with an undisclosed injury sustained against Czechia, while Marchand's absence remains unexplained. Seth Jarvis is set to make his Olympic debut, replacing Morrissey on the third line, with Travis Sanheim also stepping into the lineup.

title: Candace Owens calls claims about Erika Kirk 'absolutely vile'
description: A viral post has intensified debate over Candace Owens’ use of the term grooming in reference to a 15 year old. Critic Natly Denise accused Owens of exaggerating the situation, while Owens cited details from her own interview describing limited in person contact and online messages. The clash highlights ongoing tensions over how serious terms are defined and used in public commentary.

title: Cisco president Jeetu Patel reveals what developers company will never hire
description: Cisco's president Jeetu Patel mandates AI for all developers, aiming for half a dozen AI-coded products by 2026. This shift to spec-driven development sees human teams shrink, with AI agents tripling output. While embracing AI's potential, Cisco is investing heavily in security to prevent rogue agents, urging developers to master AI to stay relevant.

title: act check: Viral crash video falsely linked to Jutta Leerdam wardrobe malfunction
description: The viral video claiming to show Jutta Leerdam crashing and tearing her suit at the Winter Olympics is false. The clip actually shows Suzanne Schulting at a December 2025 World Cup race in Norway, as reported by NU.nl. Meanwhile, Leerdam won gold at Milano Cortina 2026, with Jake Paul celebrating emotionally.
